oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synchronized ion acceleration by ultraintense slow light
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brantov, A. V.
Govras, E. A.
Kovalev, V. F.
Bychenkov, V. Yu.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Plasma Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An effective scheme of synchronized laser-triggered ion acceleration and the corresponding theoretical model are proposed for a slow light pulse of relativistic intensity, which penetrates into a near-critical-density plasma, strongly slows, and then increases its group velocity during propagation within a target. The 3D PIC simulations confirm this concept for proton acceleration by a femtosecond petawatt-class laser pulse experiencing relativistic self-focusing, quantify the characteristics of the generated protons, and demonstrate a significant increase of their energy compared with the proton energy generated from optimized ultrathin solid dense foils.
